description.value: Base StructureDefinition for the Device Resource for a PHD

purpose.value: This resource describes the primary features of a Personal Health Device (PHD). It contains the properties, production specification, specializations, and overall type of the PHD.

definition.value: The characteristics, operational status and capabilities of a medical-related component of a medical device. A PHD is JUST the medical-related component.

comment.value:
For the initial scope, this Device resource is only applicable to describe a single node in the containment tree that is produced by the context scanner in any medical device that implements or derives from the ISO/IEEE 11073 standard and that does not represent a metric. Examples for such a node are MDS, VMD, or Channel.
With PHD medical units, there is no medical scanner and the unit is only a single node, a single 'simple' MDS, and it is static. Thus a PHD has no parent 'Device'. When a PHD supports multiple device specializations, the single unit description is still the case. A specialization is just an way to organize a set of metric objects that tend to be generated by a single sensor, but the device could expose metric objects from several specializations which usually means it has more than one sensor. In PHDs multiple specialization support is rare.

short.value: Information that uniquely describes the personal health device

definition.value: The assigned unique identification of the device that is semantically meaningful outside of the FHIR resource context. An example would be the IEEE EUI-64 System-Id or transport address. For PHDs the systemIdentifier is required and the transportAddressIdentifier is highly recommended as this is what most end users see and can obtain from the device itself or device packaging.

short.value: System Id identifier

definition.value: This entry contains the IEEE EUI-64. If absent (bad device) set to all zeros.

short.value: Indicates this is the IEEE 11073 System Id identifier
EUI-64 system identifier

definition.value: Identifies the system as an IEEE EUI.

short.value: System id value from System-Id attribute

definition.value: The System id from the System-Id attribute as an 8-byte HEX string where each byte is separated by dashes, for example FE-ED-AB-EE-DE-AD-77-C3.

comment.value:
The formatting is specified in the IEEE document Guidelines for 64-bit Global Identifier.
To allow the mapping of non-compliant proprietary devices that do not provide a system id, the value is set to all zeros in the same format, 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00

short.value: Bluetooth MAC Transport address identifier

definition.value: This entry contains the Bluetooth MAC transport address.

short.value: Indicates this is the Bluetooth Mac address identifier

definition.value: The Bluetooth MAC as an EUI-48 such as 00-E5-DE-AD-77-C3.

comment.value: Transport addresses are supposed to be unique for a given device.

short.value: MAC Transport address identifier

definition.value: This entry contains the MAC transport address.

short.value: Indicates this is the Mac address identifier

definition.value: The MAC as an EUI-48 such as 00-E5-DE-AD-77-C8.

comment.value: Transport addresses are supposed to be unique for a given device.

short.value: Manufacturer name from System-Model.manufacturer

definition.value: The manufacturer name as reported by the System-Model attribute.

comment.value: The System-Model attribute is required by the 11073 20601 specification

short.value: Serial number from the Production-Specification attribute

definition.value: The serial number as reported by the Production-Specification attribute.

comment.value: The Production-Specification is optional in the 11073-20601 specification but required by Continua. A Continua certified PHD shall report a serial number. The serial number shall be mapped if the PHD reports it.

short.value: Model number from System-Model.model

definition.value: The model number as reported by the System-Model attribute.

comment.value: The System-Model attribute is required by the 11073 20601 specification

short.value: Part number from the Production-Specification attribute

definition.value: The part number as reported by the Production-Specification attribute.

comment.value: The Production-Specification is optional in the 11073-20601 specification. This element shall be mapped if the PHD reports it

short.value: Indicates the device is a PHD.
Required MDC code system entry

definition.value: The 11073 10101 code for the PHD simple MDS.

short.value: Identifies IEEE 11073 10101 coding system

definition.value: This value identifies the IEEE 11073 10101 coding system

short.value: Indicates PHD

definition.value: The code for a Simple MDS indicating that this unit is a personal health device
A human readable display describing the meaning of the MDC code.

comment.value: It is suggested that this element contain the reference identfier for Simple MDS 'MDC_MOC_VMS_MDS_SIMP'.

short.value: This element contains an entry for each supported specialization

comment.value: There shall be a specialization entry for each specialization reported in the required System-Type-Spec-List attribute. A specialization in this case defines not only what type of measurements the PHD reports but that the PHD reports these measurements according to one of the 11073-114xx specialization standards. Most PHDs support only a single specialization such as the Blood Pressure or Pulse Oximeter specialization.

short.value: The specialization standard supported by the PHD.

comment.value: The specialization.specType comes from the System-Type-Spec-List specialization entry 'type'.

short.value: Required MDC code system entry for specializations
The 11073-10101 system identifier
The 11073-10101 specialization code from a System-Type-Spec-List[i].type.
The version of the specialization standard supported by the PHD from the System-Type-Spec-List[i].version

comment.value: The version of the specialization comes from the System-Type-Spec-List specialization entry. If a PHD supports multiple versions of the same specialization a separate Device.specialization entry is needed where the systemType elements are repeated. If the PHD reports a generic specialization (follows no 114xx specialization but conforms to the 11072-20601 standard, the version is the 20601 protocol version.

short.value: A PHD may report firmware, hardware, software, internal protocol, and Continua versions.

comment.value: There are several versions that are reported from a PHD. Firmware, Hardware, Protocol (internal, not 20601), and Software versions come from the Production-Specification attribute. The Continua version comes from the Reg-Cert-Data-List attribute. Continua compliant PHDs report at least a firmware and Continua version. A separate version entry is needed for each of the versions reported by the PHD.

short.value: Required MDC code system entry
Indicates the codes come from the MDC coding system
A code indicating the type of version the Device.version.value refers to.

comment.value:
The currently defined version codes used in this element are as shown in the Table. More than one of these versions may be reported by a PHD. Each version reported by the PHD shall be encoded.
Description CODE Reference Identifier
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hardware revision 531974 MDC_ID_PROD_SPEC_HW
Software revision 531975 MDC_ID_PROD_SPEC_SW
Firmware revision 531976 MDC_ID_PROD_SPEC_FW
Protocol 531977 MDC_ID_PROD_SPEC_PROTOCOL
Continua version 532352 MDC_REG_CERT_DATA_CONTINUA_VERSION
The Continua version comes from the Continua Reg-Cert-Data-List attribute

short.value: The version
Properties reported in BITs fields

definition.value: For each bit setting reported a BITs value, a bitProperties element is used.

comment.value: A BITs measurement is a 16 or 32-bit ASN1 BITs value where each bit means something.

short.value: Tells what the BITs item is

definition.value: One of the capabilities reported in the Mds-Time-Info.mds-time-caps-state or Reg-Cert-Data-List.regulation-status field.

comment.value: Only set 'event' types need be reported. Both set and cleared 'state' types need to be reported. The regulation status is as state type. All time capabilities are event types

short.value: Required ASN1 code system entry

definition.value: The ASN1 code made from the code and the Mder bit position

comment.value: The MDC code for the mds-time-caps-state field is 68219. Thus the ASN1 code for the case 'device supports a relative time clock', Mder bit 2, would be 68219.2. For the regulation status field the MDC code is 532354, and only bit 0 is defined. However, the regulated status is when the bit is cleared and the unregulated status is when the bit is set. That choice can be confusing.

definition.value: It is recommended to display at least the ASN1 name for the given bit meaning

short.value: Required V2 Binary code system entry

definition.value: If bit is set, code contains Y if cleared, N

short.value: The device properties represented by quantities such as clock resolution

definition.value: This element represents all those time properties that are a quantity such as the various clock resolutions and synchronization accuracy.

comment.value: If the PHD reports that one of these given properties are unknown, this element shall not be populated for that property.

short.value: The type of time quantity
The 11073-10101 MDC code for the type

definition.value: The MDC code representing the property

comment.value:
Currently PHDs support the reporting of the time quantities as shown in the Table. More may be added in the future
Description CODE Reference Identifier
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Absolute clock resolution 68222 MDC_TIME_RES_ABS
Base-offset clock resolution 68226 MDC_TIME_RES_BO
Relative time resolution 68223 MDC_TIME_RES_REL
Hi Res relative time resolution 68224 MDC_TIME_RES_REL_HI_RES
Time sync accuracy 68221 MDC_TIME_SYNC_ACCURACY
Tick Resolution 68229 MDC_ATTR_TICK_RES

definition.value: It is recommended to display at least the MDC reference identifier for the MDC code
The value of the reported quantity.
The value. All the time fields are scaled to microseconds
The unit code shall use the UCUM system
The UCUM code (for microseconds it is 'us')

short.value: The device properties represented by a list of codes such as the list of certified PHD or H-FS interfaces

definition.value: This element represents all those properties that are a list of codes. At the moment there is only certified PHD interfaces.

comment.value: Continua certified PHDs are required to have these entries.

short.value: What the coded list is
Required MDC code system entry

definition.value: The MDC code representing the property

comment.value:
Currently PHDs support the reporting of one of the coded lists as shown in the Table. More may be added in the future
Description CODE Reference Identifier Code System
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Time synchronization 68220 MDC_TIME_SYNC_PROTOCOL Certified PHD interfaces 532353 MDC_REG_CERT_DATA_CONTINUA_CERT_DEV_LIST http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/phd/CodeSystem/ContinuaPHD

definition.value: It is recommended to display at least the MDC reference identifier for the code

short.value: There shall be one valueCode entry for every item supported by the PHG in the list

definition.value: Either the http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/phd/CodeSystem/ContinuaPHD or urn:iso:std:iso:11073:10101 code systems
One of the Continua interface certification codes
